author: Ross Burden
method: Bring a large pan of water the boil. Add the celeriac and boil for ten minutes, or until tender. Add the nutmeg, salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste, and mash the celeriac to a rough paste. Add the cream and brie, stirring to mix well. Place into a warm bowl and garnish with the chervil.
ingredients: 200g/7oz celeriac, peeled and chopped,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  pinch of nutmeg,  2 tbsp double cream,  55g/2oz brie,  fresh chervil, to garnish
